BBEX3.A.GEL.USD.CA.AC.A04: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Georgia / USD 1 = GEL ... (middle)

General: The Georgian lari was introduced as legal tender with effect from 25 September 1995. The currency conversion from Georgian coupons (GEK) to the lari occurred at the rate of GEK 1 000 000 = GEL 1; the lari has been the sole legal tender since 2 October 1995.
Source: National Bank of Georgia, Tbilisi.

Methodology: The exchange rates calculated between January and August 1995 were included in the calculation at the rate of GEK 1 000 000 = GEL 1. Until 2000, calculated on the basis of month-end rates, and from 2001 on the basis of mid-month and month-end rates.
